definition: quarter (hour)/moment/to carve/to engrave/to cut/oppressive/classifier for short time intervals

sentences.english: Memories of happier days were enshrined in my heart.
sentences.chinese: 以前快樂日子的記憶銘刻在我的心中。

sentences.english: North entrance to the embedded Taming stone, quite detailed records.
sentences.chinese: 門外北向嵌有塔銘刻石，記載頗詳。

sentences.english: We must engrave the texts on our hearts and souls.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須將經文銘刻我們的心裏和靈魂裏。

sentences.english: Your very voice is in my heartbeat, sweeter than my dream.
sentences.chinese: 你獨特的嗓音銘刻在我愛的心跳裏，比夢還甜。

sentences.english: That moment is forever engraved on my heart.
sentences.chinese: 那一刻永遠地銘刻在了我的心上。

sentences.english: The plane crash was branded on his mind.
sentences.chinese: 飛機墜毀的情景銘刻在他的心中。

sentences.english: Your very voice is in my heartbeat sweeter than my dream.
sentences.chinese: 你獨特的聲音銘刻在我的心跳裏比我的夢還甜美。

sentences.english: His words will be forever imprinted on my mind.
sentences.chinese: 他的話將永遠銘刻在我的心中。

sentences.english: The shining image of Premier Zhou Enlai is indelibly engraved on the memory of the people.
sentences.chinese: 周總理的光輝形象永遠銘刻在人民的心中。

sentences.english: The tragic event is sharply etched into my memory.
sentences.chinese: 那起悲慘的事件深深地銘刻在我的記憶中。

sentences.english: We can spur grelocated on deeds thlocated on history will mark declistinges effectively as centuries from now.
sentences.chinese: 我們能鞭策將會被歷史永世銘刻的壯偉的事業。

sentences.english: The scene will remain forever engraved on my memory.
sentences.chinese: 那情景將永遠銘刻在我的記憶中。

sentences.english: These I will wear as a wedding band, a symbol of permanence.
sentences.chinese: 我將披起婚嫁的絲帶，作爲銘刻永恆的標誌。

sentences.english: And that is what is on his tombstone.
Look back. Laugh, cry, and remember.
sentences.chinese: 回想疇昔，我們哭過，笑過，末端銘刻。

sentences.english: Baptism of by the blood, the sword edge inscribes I the real name.
sentences.chinese: 以血之洗禮，劍刃銘刻吾之真名。

definition: to place great importance on/to treasure
to load into/to record/to write into/to enter (data)/to go into (the records)/to go down (in history)
passed on from generation to generation (idiom); to hand down
handed down from ancient times/family heirloom
to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)
after hard work and numerous revisions (idiom)/the vicissitudes of life
